Ok, I might show off my new zite right now
It's just a project management zite.
You can create todo lists, create conversations (almost like github issues, but for the team rather than the public), add files and attach those files to conversations

I will also interface with a GitCenter merger zite so you can manage your repo from the zite, *and* KxoQA merger zite can be created specifically for your project so that people can ask questions about your project.
I'm kinda modelling it after Asana I think it's called. But some features from this are also used in for example GitHub, GitLab, etc.
Like issues on those websites act as like todo lists kinda, but a lot of them are created by users.
KxoDo will let you create a completely private project too. Additionally, it doesn't have to be just used for development projects - you can use it for any type of project.
And private projects will be encrypted - including the files (although not exactly sure how I'll do this part yet)
Btw, do note that on stream, I have the zite zoomed in 130%
I've been mostly working on getting all or the majority of the interface done first before moving on to the backend/db
We started this project 5 months ago, and actually had streaming *working* 5 months ago
But then I left and gitcenter left and zerolstn started working on other things, so we just never got around to it until literally like 2 days ago when gitcenter finished it up
We're going to be adding some more things soon
No, we use a very new Browser API called MediaStream and MediaRecorder
But, OBS support will be added in the future, we just need to figure out how to do it first
(we won't *require* obs, but for people who would like to use it - it'd be nice)
Yeah, obs is better for performance, which is why we're adding it in the future.
Actually, we can support multiple recording software, not just obs
Depends on how we actually program this though, I suppose
(What I mean by that is - if we just use an RTCP/RTP server that just proxies over to ZeroNet - then any recording software that can stream to RTCP/RTP will work with it)
I *think* rtp/rtcp is the correct name for that protocol, not sure
I was considering doing some programming, but I'm not feeling like it at the moment.
I think I'm going to stop the stream soon
Hello!
Currently livestreaming a new zite I'm making @ twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/krixano/
Hello!
It's going to use PeerMessage... once I get everything sorted
(which means it'll be multiplayer)
Ok... now I think I'm ready for PeerMessage!
The latency for peermessage shouldn't be that bad.. not from my tests with gitcenter
PeerMessage usually sends very quickly... of course, games probably require lower latency than chat applications, but idk... we'll see
I also need to fix this inaccuracy with the rendering of the boxes... there's probably some decimal getting in there somewhere.
There we go! Fixed the rendering of the blocks!
Ok, I need someone to test it now: http://127.0.0.1:43110/12xozBV7dYskrNQ2G5srnzsTgStaX6Coph/
I need to fix the rendering of players, otherwise it's almost done!
Ok, I've just published the fix!
Yeah, it's really slow
I'm broadcasting the player position quite a lot though, so perhaps lowering how many times I send player position will help
Made a few more changes....
I mean.... it's **kinda** working, lol
Ok, made another publish
It's jumping because I'm not sending player positions often enough... I've lowered it so they should send more often
I have like no experience making online games like this, so yeah... lol
Did you refresh after my latest update? Your character jumps around a lot for me
A trick/hack I can do is to just make the character move slower, lol
Ah
Ok, published again... made the character slower :)
Ok, so now I need to do research on this interpolation stuff
There's also prediction too
I made a small update.. if you're still on
It looks like every so often it just lags sending the actual message... idk if that's a zeronet thing, a javascript thing, or what

Idk... but I think a big part of the ping or the lag is either from you using tor, and/or from ZeroNet itself (and not necessarily the way PeerMessage is designed - because broadcasting with only 2 peers is the same as just sending directly to a computer)
Not yet... I'll do that soon
I have to setup and install zeronet on another computer, so yeah
Also, btw, I stopped streaming
Thanks

Hello!
I know why
It's a CORS problem and tor and chrome are extra protective about CORS issues
Basically, nofish needs to fix this CORS crap, lol

Basically, when I'm loading an image into a canvas - btw, there *might* be a way that I can get around this, but it's a bit annoying honestly - and then modifying the image data of the canvas (that's the part where I get the cors issue). For some reason it thinks the image I've loaded isn't from the same website as the page... this has been a ZeroNet problem for quite a while, I think even svgs have this problem in tor browser, or at least used to.
I think it was both svgs and fonts, actually
People previously thought one of my older zites was buggy because of this **ZeroNet** bug. I thought it was fixed by now, but idk...
I bet there's still an open issue on it... let me check...
Here's one of the issues... this one dealt with fonts: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1940
It's closed even though it shouldn't be
(nofish didn't close it - the creator of the issue did, multiple times)

Here's another issue about this, but this one is apparently fixed, idk..
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1931
Here's an image of the error I get in chrome:
![alt text](data/users/174zuaSY2Fh9K6ZVFHe3EP45wnAsvAghGd/ac8dpd2jsujdvm4rqur3u8a8r168frre.png)
You know what... hold on a sec
Ivanq might have found a fix
Turns out I need an ajax key... and of course, this isn't in the zeronet docs
I can load the image in javascript, but browsers protect against modifying content loaded from other websites. Currently, the browser thinks this image was loaded from another website.
But ZeroNet has this thing called an ajax key
Right... ZeroNet docs suck
Also, I'm not acutaly explicitly making an ajax request, I'm just doing `new Image()`, which does the ajax request automatically
Anyways... all of this hackiness by ZeroNet is basically the result of the stupid iframe. Hopefully ivanq can come up with something that will let us remove the crappy iframe
Ok @fractalzoomer, can you try the website now? Just posted the fix
This time it *wasn't* a zeronet bug, lol. Although, I'm questioning why this ajax key thing is needed....
That image is from tor browser?
Idk... I think tor browser is extra-picky about Canvases
I tested it on chrome though
You know... I could just make a native version of the game that's an executable that will interface with ZeroFrame.... I'll have to ask anoa/zerolstn if he can help me out since he's done it before.
The whole canvas thing in tor browser has been a problem for a long time - ZeroMe's image upload doesn't work because of it.
I can try to look into it a little more, but I'm not so sure there'll be a solution for tor browser - which is unfortunate given the whole purpose of ZeroNet, lol
Thanks for testing it, btw
I have some more new zites coming up soon... me and ivanq are going to try to work on a few things that will slightly improve the work developers have to do and make zites a bit better.
I also have plans to work with anoa/zerolstn on something....
Ivanq created an issue to be able to remove the iframe, but there was a particular reason why he stopped I think, not sure.
Does it break many zites? Idk, I never use tor browser. He fixed the font problem I thought, so the only zites that I have heard were broken in tor were ones that used Canvas.
Ah, so he *didn't* fix the font problem, lol
I thought that was fixed, but I guess not

I can get on now if you have time

other people are running clients, but they aren't 100% working atm, and it's a *very* simple fix that I'll do today I think
